title: Remove "blue bar" around login forms
content:
Hi, Is there a way (via about:config or userChrome.css) to remove the blue rectangle around login forms ? This is very ugly, not even symmetric (on the right side is not the same) ...

Using Firefox 84.0.2 on macOS Catalina.

Thanks!
creator: qtumev

title: Download arrow on toolbar disappeared how do I get it back.
content: My download arrow on toolbar disappeared how do I get it back. I am not sure what happened I am visually challenged and my have hit a wrong button, plz help
creator: choicesfornow

title: After recent Firefox update, it switches from http to https
content: A while back I noticed that when loading any one of my sites in Firefox, the URL changes itself from http https which causes the non-secure sites to crash. This is a major problem for me that makes my sites all but inaccessible to please advise what to do to stop it, preferably at the server level so that visitors to the sites won’t have to fuss with it individually!
creator: tmp4

title: Links Opening in New Window
content:
When I click on a link, Firefox opens the link in a new window, even though I have "Open links in tabs instead of new windows" checked in Options. I want links to open in a new tab in the same window. I'm updated to the most current version of Firefox, too. How can I fix it?

Thanks, Leah
creator: Lkreuter23

title: GerardoPcp04
content: supongo q lo q me dijiste q pruebe tiene q ver con algo viejo porq yo tengo la ultima version firefox en windows 10 y leyendo lo q ue me enviaste, despues de Información para solucionar problemas, no puedo seguir porque no me aparece nada de lo que dice ahi noasi q ni idea de como copiar carpeta de perfil ni que hacer y pienso q realmente esta version es horrenda porque nunca jamas me paso esto. Si se te ocurre otra cosa, decime por favor-gracias
creator: reinadelcielo2050

title: FF slowing my online activity
content:
Why does FF show 5 windows in the Task Manager when I have only one FF window/tab open? FF is using 50% (one gig+) of memory even though there is only one FF window/tab open. This is slowing my computers online activity—sometimes greatly. Is there a way to fix this, other than not using FF?

I am using FF 84.0.2 (64-bit) with a 64-bit PC. All critical and security updates are up to date and the machine seems to be free of any malware.

Thank you for your help.
creator: fastfood

title: Firefox prevents the tilde (~) key from working.
content:
Firefox prevents the typing (~) key from working on the typing.com website, and unfortunately I can't go through the lessons on the website because of this problem.

I tested in other browsers if the problem persisted and it appears that only firefox exhibits this behavior.

I also tested starting the browser by the way that disables the extensions and I continue the key without working.

Please, does anyone know any solution to this problem? I loved the Firefox browser and I don't want to leave it just because of that.
creator: matxx_sas
